name: conquerable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
possible to defeat or take control of by force: For the first time the city seemed conquerable.
possible to deal with or successfully fight against: These fears are conquerable.
More examplesFewer examplesAt that time, America promised conquerable territory.In this game you battle against other players to control more than 80 conquerable ports. With these surfboards, he says, the biggest waves in the world will be conquerable.This apparently insoluble dilemma is ultimately conquerable.
